bullets.text: Bitcoin surges to new high above $125,000 as investors seek safety amid political uncertainty and shutdown risks.
Popular 2025 carry-like trade boosts gold and bitcoin; momentum may persist through a U.S. government shutdown.
Japan stocks hit record highs after LDP picks pro-stimulus Sanae Takaichi, reinforcing expectations for continued easing and fiscal support.
Netanyahu embraces Gaza deal under Trump pressure, framing it as personal victory; potential pivot in conflict dynamics and regional risk.
Nuclear power gains public and market acceptance, with SMRs advancing to meet surging AI-driven electricity demand.
Prologis, Amazon, and Meta commit to low-carbon concrete, signaling decarbonization pressure across construction supply chains.
Germany outfitted 500,000 balconies with plug-in solar, accelerating distributed generation and household energy resilience.
Costco to sell Ozempic and Wegovy, mainstreaming GLP-1 access and pressuring food, retail pharmacy, and insurer economics.
Higher-dose semaglutide helped nearly half of patients lose 20% body weight, intensifying competition in obesity therapeutics.
Researchers identify hidden protein that suppresses hunger, offering a potential new anti-obesity drug target beyond GLP-1.
Discovery of a cellular "power switch" pathway could transform Parkinson's treatments by restoring neuron energy regulation.
South Korea's government cloud storage destroyed by fire with no backups, exposing severe digital infrastructure and continuity risks.
OpenAI's "Stargate" data-center push accelerates massive U.S. AI compute buildout, reshaping power, land, and chip demand.
Craft breweries struggle as sales wane, signaling weakening premium discretionary spending and market consolidation pressures.
